gameComponents

Class OpticalObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameComponents.GameComponent
      • gameComponents.OpticalObject
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Mirror, RefractiveZone

    public abstract class OpticalObject
extends GameComponent
    Virtual Optics

    OpticalObject is the base class for game components that can interact with Ray objects

    Author:
    Darrin Fong, Tieme Togola
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

                 java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double p1)
        Different optical objects have different ways of setting their normal lines
        Parameters:
        intersection - The point where a ray segment impacts this optical object
        p1 - The source point of the ray segment intersecting this optical object

      • reflection

        protected double reflection(double m1,
                double m2)
        Computes the slope of a ray reflected on this optical object
        Parameters:
        m1 - Slope of the incident ray segment
        m2 - Slope of the normal line of this optical object
        Returns:
        The slope of the reflected ray segment

      • bend

        protected abstract java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double bend(java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double source,
                                java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double intersec,
                                LineEq segment)
        Determines the orientation of the ray segment that hit this optical object by returning a point that is far away in that direction
        Parameters:
        source - The source point of the ray segment that hit this optical object
        intersec - The intersection point of the ray segment and this optical object
        segment - The ray segment that hit this optical object
        Returns:
        The point at the end of the Ray object path that hit this optical object

      • checkSide

        protected abstract boolean checkSide(LineEq incidentLine,
                LineEq resultLine,
                java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double source,
                java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double intersec)
        Checks if the reflected/refracted ray is on the correct side of the normal line. (Varies from one optical object to another)
        Parameters:
        incidentLine -
        resultLine -
        source - The source point of the ray segment that hit this optical object
        intersec - The intersection point of the ray segment and this optical object
        Returns:
        False if the reflected/refracted ray is on the correct side, true otherwise

      • checkOrientation

        protected abstract boolean checkOrientation(java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double source,
                       java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double intersection,
                       LineEq segment)
        Determines whether the incident ray segment will interact with the optical surface or not
        Parameters:
        source - The source point of the ray segment that hit this optical object
        intersection - The intersection point of the ray segment and this optical object
        segment - The ray segment that hit this optical object
        Returns:
        True if the ray can interact with this side of the optical object, false otherwise
